conclusion: Analyze forces on the wire with current in different directions using magnetic forces and equilibrium.
Identify forces: Current \( I \) from \( a \) to \( b \) causes magnetic force \( F_m = I L B \) downward; Current \( 2I \) from \( b \) to \( a \) causes \( F_m = 2I L B \) upward.
First scenario: Downward forces are weight \( mg \) and magnetic force \( F_{m1} = I L B \). Spring scale force \( F_1 = mg + I L B \).
Second scenario: Magnetic force \( F_{m2} = 2I L B \) acts upward. Downward force is only weight \( mg \). Net force \( F_2 = mg - 2I L B \).
Solve for \( B \) using equations: \( F_1 = mg + I L B \) and \( F_2 = mg - 2I L B \).
Subtract equations: \( F_1 - F_2 = I L B + 2I L B = 3I L B \).
Solve for \( B \): \( B = \frac{F_1 - F_2}{3I L} \).
